title: Online Bipartite Matching via Smoothness. (arXiv:2203.13140v2 [cs.GT] UPDATED)
abstract: The online bipartite matching problem has offline buyers desiring to be matched to online items. The analysis of online bipartite matching of Eden et al. (2021) is a smoothness proof (Syrgkanis and Tardos, 2013). Moreover, it can be interpreted as combining a $\lambda = 1-1/e$ value covering (which holds for single-dimensional agents and randomized auctions) and $\mu = 1$ revenue covering (Hartline et al., 2014). Note that value covering is a fact about single-dimensional agents and has nothing to do with the underlying feasibility setting. Thus, the essential new result from Eden et al. (2021) is that online bipartite matching is $\mu=1$ revenue covered. A number of old and new observations follow from this perspective.

Title: Online Bipartite Matching via Smoothness. (arXiv:2203.13140v2 [cs.GT] UPDATED)
Abstract: The online bipartite matching problem has offline buyers desiring to be matched to online items. The analysis of online bipartite matching of Eden et al. (2021) is a smoothness proof (Syrgkanis and Tardos, 2013). Moreover, it can be interpreted as combining a $\lambda = 1-1/e$ value covering (which holds for single-dimensional agents and randomized auctions) and $\mu = 1$ revenue covering (Hartline et al., 2014). Note that value covering is a fact about single-dimensional agents and has nothing to do with the underlying feasibility setting. Thus, the essential new result from Eden et al. (2021) is that online bipartite matching is $\mu=1$ revenue covered. A number of old and new observations follow from this perspective.
translated_title: 基于平滑性的在线二分匹配
translated_abstract: 在线二分匹配问题涉及到离线买家希望与在线商品匹配。Eden等人（2021）对在线二分匹配进行了平滑性证明（Syrgkanis和Tardos，2013）。此外，它可以被解释为将$\lambda = 1-1/e$值覆盖（适用于一维代理和随机拍卖）和$\mu = 1$收入覆盖（Hartline等人，2014）结合在一起。注意，值覆盖是关于一维代理的事实，与底层可行性设置无关。因此，Eden等人（2021）的重要新结果是在线二分匹配是$\mu = 1$收入覆盖的。从这个角度出发，得出了许多旧的和新的观察结果。
tldr: Eden et al. (2021)证明了在线二分匹配问题是$\mu=1$收入覆盖的，这个结果结合了一维代理和随机拍卖的值覆盖概念。
en_tdlr: Eden et al. (2021) proved that the online bipartite matching problem is $\mu=1$ revenue covered, combining the concept of value covering for one-dimensional agents and randomized auctions.
